column4: Could anyone help me configure my locales, I need support for norwegian letters in bash
bash as such does not deal with character sets. You need to configure your terminal program or console.
are you using the console or gnome-terminal?
ubuntu seems to support three Norwegian languages. Which do you need?
norwegian(no) or norwegian bokml (nb) should both be fine
'sudo apt-get install language-pack-gnome-no language-pack-gnome-nb', then log out of gnome and choose your preferred language at the login screen.
what's the symptom of "terminal won't understand them"?
I could write a file with a word, e.g. fl, and when I open the file in the editor (gvim usually), everything seems fine, but if I use the "more"-command, I'll get a output like "f l"
it could be that the font you've chosen for the terminal doesn't supply that character. Change the font via Edit-Current Profile
that doesn't seem to work either
you may need the language-support-nX package(s) as well
I have all the norwegian language-support packages installed. Any other ideas?
so you've tried different fonts in the terminal?
yes, and nothing seemed to work
sorry, out of ideas. Have you asked in #ubuntu-no ?
I'll try now, thanks for your help
